In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function in Julia that wraps a string to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_line = ""
    lines = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(curr_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, curr_line)
            curr_line = ""
        end
        curr_line = curr_line * " " * word
    end

    push!(lines, curr_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here is an example usage that wraps a string to text width 20:

```julia
str = "This is a test string that will be wrapped to width 20"
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str, 20)

println(wrapped_str)
```

This would print:

```
This is a test 
string that will be 
wrapped to width 20
```

The key aspects are:

- Split text into words 
- Keep track of current line length
- Start new line when max width would be exceeded
- Join lines with newlines at the end
